greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of super perfect rhythmic tilings of [0,3n-1] with triples.
comment: A super perfect tiling of the line with triples consists of n groups of three evenly spaced points, each group having a different common interval such that all points of the line are covered, and such that all intervals are inferior or equal to n (thus, each interval belongs to [1..n]).
formula: For n>1, a(n) = A059108(n)*2 because A059108 ignores reflected solutions. - _Fausto A. C. Cariboni_, May 20 2017
example: It can also be represented as:
